business.headline: Sensex opens 227 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%Sensex opens 227 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%

Gold set for 50-year best, silver breaks records: Where should money go in 2026?After months of sharp gains, some investors are locking in profits, leading to short-term weakness in gold and silver. Even so, prices remain far higher than where they began the year.

Gig and delivery workers call for December 31 strike: Key demands explainedWorkers had already held a nationwide flash strike on December 25, which led to a 50–60% disruption in services in several cities.

Disney to pay $10m to settle children's privacy violations on YouTubeRegulators alleged that Disney failed to identify certain videos as being directed at children, despite the content being clearly child-focused. As a result, children were allegedly served targeted advertisements and had their personal information collected without proper notice to or consent from parents.

India imposes 3-year steel tariffs, targets cheap China importsIndia has imposed higher import duties on select steel products after trade regulators flagged a sharp rise in low-priced imports hurting domestic steelmakers.

India becomes 4th-largest economy by overtaking Japan, set to pip Germany by 2030India's real GDP grew 8.2 per cent in Q2 of 2025-26, driven by strong domestic consumption, urban demand, and structural reforms, the Centre said.

Why treating bonuses as permanent income can backfire on your financesMany people see bonuses as extra money and quickly adjust their spending or investments. But treating variable income as permanent can quietly strain finances and create stress later, even when salaries remain unchanged.

China asks chipmakers to use at least 50% local equipment: ReportLarge public investments are supporting this push. Through the government-backed "Big Fund", China has poured hundreds of billions of yuan into the sector, including a major new funding phase launched in 2024.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower as FII outflows weigh on investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 20.46 points to close at 84,675.08, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by just 3.25 points to end at 25,938.85.

Home buying with purpose: Simple steps to turn property into wealthAcross metro cities and several tier-2 cities, residential prices have moved up steadily over the last decade. Land prices have increased, construction costs are higher, and most new housing supply is coming in the mid to premium segments.

These Indian billionaires added the most wealth in 2025According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Mukesh Ambani was the biggest wealth gainer among Indian billionaires in 2025. Ambani added $16.50 billion to his net worth during the year.

New Year 2026: 5 easy personal finance tips for better money controlWith rising costs and busy lives, managing money can feel overwhelming. As 2026 begins, these easy personal finance tips can help you stay organised and confident about your money.

Last date for revised ITR is tomorrow, December 31: Will the deadline be extended?There is only one day left to file a revised ITR for the current assessment year. With growing pressure on taxpayers and professionals, many are now wondering whether the Income Tax Department will extend the revised ITR deadline.

BNW unveils Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al KhaimahBNW Developments introduced the first Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al Khaimah with a launch attended by celebrities and industry stakeholders.

Only 1 day left for PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline: Are you legally exempt?With December 31 just a day away, taxpayers are running out of time to link PAN with Aadhaar. For most people, the process is mandatory, but some individuals are legally exempt from this requirement.

IndiGo hikes pilot allowances after rostering chaos, flight cancellationsThe revised allowances will come into effect from January 1 and apply across multiple categories, including domestic layover, night operations, deadhead travel and a newly introduced tail-swap allowance.

Explained: Silver's record rally and the China connectionDespite a recent dip, silver is still up more than 150% for the year. Silver prices recently climbed to around $82.5 an ounce, or roughly Rs 254,000 per kg, marking a lifetime high.

Why gold, silver and copper left stocks behind in 2025In a year defined by uncertainty, metals quietly did the heavy lifting, reminding investors that when confidence fades and supply tightens, tangible assets often speak louder than forecasts.
Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Tata Steel down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 113.64 points to 84,581.90, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 29.60 points to 25,912.50 as of 9:36 am.

Silver prices today: Why are rates falling and what should investors knowSilver fell 8.7% in a single day, marking its biggest one-day fall since August 2020. This sharp drop cleared some excess heat from a rally that had turned very steep in recent weeks.

entertainment.headline: Tu Meri Main Tera box office Day 6: Kartik film sees drop amid Dhurandhar storm The romantic comedy 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' has experienced a notable decrease in box office earnings after its initial release amid the 'Dhurandhar' release. The film's performance highlights challenges in sustaining momentum against established competitors.

Once again Nick Jonas turns DJ, vibes to Priyanka's Mujhse Shaadi Karogi. Watch Nick Jonas' upbeat dance to Priyanka Chopra's iconic Bollywood track with the Jonas Brothers has captured attention online. In his latest clip, the singer-actor could be seen grooving to Mujhse Shaadi Karogi.

AP Dhillon concert row: Orry defends Tara, Veer with unedited clip Orry posted behind-the-scenes concert footage as speculation mounted over Veer Pahariya's reaction to Tara Sutaria and AP Dhillon's onstage moment. The clip contrasts with earlier clips that went viral.

Dhurandhar box office Day 26: Ranveer Singh's film roars at Rs 1,095 crore worldwide Director Aditya Dhar's spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' experienced significant growth at the box office, with collections rising during the New Year's Eve period. The film, starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, is breaking records in both domestic and overseas markets.

Mammootty pays last respects to Mohanlal's mother, Chiranjeevi, Shiva Rajkumar mourn Mammootty and his wife visited Mohanlal's residence in Kochi following the death of Mohanlal's mother, Santhakumari, with several film industry figures, including Shiva Rajkumar and Chiranjeevi, expressing their condolences.

Isiah Whitlock Jr, popular The Wire star, dies at 71 Actor Isiah Whitlock Jr, celebrated for his performance as Senator Clay Davis in The Wire, has died at 71 in New York. His career spanned decades and included collaborations with Spike Lee and notable appearances in films and television.

Dhurandhar lost nearly Rs 90 crore due to Middle East ban: Overseas distributor Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar was banned in the Middle East. The film's overseas distributor claimed that the film has lost nearly Rs 90 crore due to the Gulf ban.

Explained: Akshaye Khanna's Drishyam 3 exit and the storm after Dhurandhar success Akshaye Khanna's exit from Drishyam 3 has sparked industry outrage, legal threats and debate -- raising questions about silence, stardom and the timing of making choices in Bollywood.

Finally got him to pose: Kareena Kapoor's New Year vacay pic of Saif is pure gold Kareena Kapoor Khan offered a rare peek into her family holiday with Saif Ali Khan and sons, posting relaxed photos. Alongside the photos, she added quirky captions.

Sunkissed pics, donuts, love: Samantha-Raj's Lisbon holiday sparks honeymoon buzz Samantha and Raj Nidimoru have been seen exploring Lisbon and other Portuguese sites, sharing moments from their honeymoon. The couple's photos have attracted warm wishes from fans and colleagues.

Stranger Things: Noah Schnapp opens up on Will's coming-out scene, calls it perfect Noah Schnapp, who plays Will Byers in Stranger Things, reveals his plans to watch the series finale in cinemas with friends, family, and fans. Amid backlash, the actor opened up about his coming-out scene in episode seven.

Dragon fame Ashwath Marimuthu in talks to direct Rajinikanth's Thalaivar 173: Report With several directors having narrated scripts over the past few months, reports now suggest that Dragon director Ashwath Marimuthu has emerged as the frontrunner to helm Rajinikanth's next film, tentatively titled Thalaivar 173.

Golden Sparrow emerges as YouTube's most-watched Tamil track of 2025 The song Golden Sparrow from Dhanush's Nilavukku En Mel Ennadi Kobam emerged as the most-viewed Tamil song on YouTube in 2025. GV Prakash shared the update on X and thanked his team.

Stranger Things 5 finale trailer: Epic ending sets stage for ultimate Vecna showdown The Stranger Things Season 5 finale titled The Rightside Up will release on December 31, streaming on Netflix and screening in theatres. The final episode promises an epic showdown as Eleven prepares to face Vecna and the fate of Hawkins hangs in the balance.

Ranbir Kapoor's Love and War delay leaves Ramayana team disappointed: Report Ranbir Kapoor's Love and War, directed by Sanjay Leela Bhansali, has reportedly been delayed with its release now likely in August or September 2026. The extended shoot has also impacted the timeline of Ramayana, leaving some members of the team disappointed.

Avengers Doomsday teaser: Chris Hemsworth's God of Thunder, invokes Odin before war Chris Hemswotrth is set to return as the God of Thunder, Thor in Marvel's Avengers: Doomsday: The film also features actor Chris Evans in a pivotal role.

Hrithik Roshan in talks to lead Don 3 after Ranveer Singh's exit: Report Hrithik Roshan has reportedly emerged as a strong contender to lead Don 3 after Ranveer Singh's reported exit from the project.

Kamal Haasan sends condolences to Mohanlal after mother Santhakumari's death Kamal Haasan expressed condolences to Mohanlal after the death of his mother, Santhakumari, at the age of 90. Haasan assured Mohanlal of his friends' unwavering support.

Tom Hiddleston opens up about Loki's role in Avengers: Doomsday Tom Hiddleston reveals insights into his enduring connection with Loki and shares details about his upcoming projects, including the highly anticipated Avengers: Doomsday and his return to The Night Manager.

general news.headline: After Trump, China claims credit for mediating India-Pakistan conflictChinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Tuesday said China had "mediated" India-Pakistan tensions in May. India has consistently maintained that the four-day confrontation was resolved through direct military-to-military communication, without the involvement of any external power.

Live: 148 Delhi flights cancelled as thick fog blankets city, train services also hitDelhi Air Pollution Live Updates: Delhi-NCR witnessed low visibility early on Wednesday as dense fog covered the region. The Air Quality Early Warning System warned that air quality is likely to slip into the 'severe' category on December 31 and January 1 before easing back to 'very poor' on January 2, with similar conditions expected for the following six days. Officials attributed the poor outlook to an unfavourable ventilation index below 6,000 sq m per second and low wind speeds under 10 kmph. The India Meteorological Department has forecast dense fog conditions for Wednesday. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Natti chicken feast planned as Siddaramaiah closes in on record Karnataka CM tenureWith a week to go, Siddaramaiah is poised to break Devaraj Urs's record and cement his legacy as Karnataka's longest-serving chief minister.

Leave Yemen in 24 hours: Why Saudi Arabia warned brother UAE with bombsSaudi Arabia issued a stark warning to its brother nation, the UAE, as it launched an airstrike on Yemen's Mukalla port. Riyadh said it targeted weapons shipped from the UAE meant for a separatist outfit, and the Saudi-backed Yemenese regime issued a 24-hour ultimatum for Abu Dhabi's forces to leave Yemen. What has made the two Arab powerhouses take on one another?

Women feel betrayed, desert Bangladesh's NCP. Did they ignore Jamaat DNA?Several prominent women leaders of the NCP, the Bangladesh students' party backing the Muhammad Yunus-led interim set-up, have either spoken against the outfit or resigned in the last one week. Behind the anger is the NCP's alliance with the radical Jamaat-e-Islami. Did they overlook the Jamaat DNA?

Health trends 2025: The science, the spending and the shift in mindsetIn 2025, Indians didn't just chase weight loss or wellness hacks — they began renegotiating their relationship with food, medicine and their own bodies.

Anti-India leader Osman Hadi's murder accused says he is in Dubai, denies roleA key suspect in the murder of student leader Osman Hadi has denied involvement, claiming political conspiracy while residing abroad. The case continues to stir national unrest and police investigations in Bangladesh.

Gold set for 50-year best, silver breaks records: Where should money go in 2026?After months of sharp gains, some investors are locking in profits, leading to short-term weakness in gold and silver. Even so, prices remain far higher than where they began the year.

Margins to mainstream: India women's cricket team wins Battle of the Sexes in 20252025 was the year Indian women's cricket earned the respect it deserved, with India lifting their maiden ICC title — the ODI World Cup. The challenge for India in the coming year will be to maintain that consistency and, perhaps, add a T20 World Cup title at Lord's to their growing legacy.

From Op Sindoor to precision strikes: Army's 10 key milestones in 2025The Indian Army highlighted ten major milestones of 2025, a year marked by combat operations, rapid modernisation, and a focus on precision strikes, unmanned systems and joint capabilities.

Swiggy, Zomato, other gig delivery workers on New Year's Eve strike: Key demandsWorkers had already held a nationwide flash strike on December 25, which led to a 50–60% disruption in services in several cities.

Dhurandhar lost nearly Rs 90 crore due to Middle East ban: Overseas distributorRanveer Singh's Dhurandhar was banned in the Middle East. The film's overseas distributor claimed that the film has lost nearly Rs 90 crore due to the Gulf ban.

Explained: Akshaye Khanna's Drishyam 3 exit and the storm after Dhurandhar successAkshaye Khanna's exit from Drishyam 3 has sparked industry outrage, legal threats and debate -- raising questions about silence, stardom and the timing of making choices in Bollywood.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

Mullahs must leave: Massive protests break out in Iran. Is there a Trump angle?Iran is witnessing its largest unrest in three years. Chants of "mullahs must leave" and "death to the dictator" have echoed across major Iranian cities as protesters clashed with security forces of the Ayatollah Ali Khamenei-led theocratic regime. The eruption of anger and turmoil has been fuelled by a collapsing rial, record inflation and years of sanctions, amid renewed American pressure under US President Donald Trump.

Carlsen now a 20-time world champion, ends 2025 with Rapid and Blitz doubleMagnus Carlsen extended his dominance by winning a record ninth World Blitz title along with the Rapid gold medal in Doha. Carlsen defeated Uzbek GM Nodirbek Abdusattorov after producing a stunning, unexpected pawn move in the fourth game of the clash to seal a 2.5–1.5 victory.

Video: Vande Bharat Sleeper train aces 180 kmph trial, water test shows stabilityThe test was conducted under the supervision of the Commissioner of Railway Safety, and a demonstration of ride stability using glasses of water – remaining steady even at top speed – highlighted the train's technological sophistication, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said.

CBSE reschedules Class 10, 12 board exams set for March 3. Check revised datesThe CBSE Class 10 and Class 12 exams earlier set for March 3, 2026, have been rescheduled due to administrative reasons, while all other exam dates remain unchanged.

New Year in a haze as fog blinds Delhi-NCR; flight ops hit, AQI still very poorDense fog in Delhi-NCR caused flight delays and cancellations early on Wednesday. The persistent fog worsened already toxic air just hours before the New Year, though the weather department has forecast light rain.

Ram Mandir's Pran Pratistha anniversary today, Rajnath Singh to offer prayersThe Ram Mandir in Ayodhya celebrates the second Pran Pratistha Dwadashi with special rituals and grand ceremonies. Heightened security and large crowds reflect the event's significance and challenges in managing the influx.

Stranger Things 5 finale trailer: Epic ending sets stage for ultimate Vecna showdownThe Stranger Things Season 5 finale titled The Rightside Up will release on December 31, streaming on Netflix and screening in theatres. The final episode promises an epic showdown as Eleven prepares to face Vecna and the fate of Hawkins hangs in the balance.

60 injured after 2 loco trains carrying workers collide inside Uttarakhand tunnelA collision between two internal transport trains at a hydropower project in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district has resulted in multiple injuries, prompting a swift rescue and medical response. Authorities are investigating the cause to enhance safety measures and prevent future accidents.

India imposes 3-year steel tariffs, targets cheap China importsIndia has imposed higher import duties on select steel products after trade regulators flagged a sharp rise in low-priced imports hurting domestic steelmakers.

Priyanka Gandhi's son Raihan Vadra to get engaged to girlfriend Aviva BaigRaihan Vadra, son of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Robert Vadra, is set to get engaged to Aviva Baig in a private family event in Rajasthan. The ceremony is planned for early January 2026, keeping the celebrations intimate and away from public attention.

sports.headline: Indian sports in 2025: Handshake rows, stampedes and controversies that shaped the year From league uncertainty and safety scares to stampedes, political snubs and war halting the IPL, Indian sport in 2025 was defined by chaos, controversy and failures that overshadowed competition.

Carlsen now a 20-time world champion, ends 2025 with Rapid and Blitz double Magnus Carlsen extended his dominance by winning a record ninth World Blitz title along with the Rapid gold medal in Doha. Carlsen defeated Uzbek GM Nodirbek Abdusattorov after producing a stunning, unexpected pawn move in the fourth game of the clash to seal a 2.5–1.5 victory.

Margins to mainstream: India women's cricket team wins Battle of the Sexes in 2025 2025 was the year Indian women's cricket earned the respect it deserved, with India lifting their maiden ICC title — the ODI World Cup. The challenge for India in the coming year will be to maintain that consistency and, perhaps, add a T20 World Cup title at Lord's to their growing legacy.

Jemimah selfie, debutants lifting trophy: India sign off in style after Sri Lanka sweep Jemimah Rodrigues took her signature selfie and the debutants Kamalini and Vaishanavi Sharma lifted the trophy for the side as India celebrated their 5-0 series win over Sri Lanka in style on Tuesday, December 30.

Carlsen reaches World blitz C'ships final after turnaround, Erigaisi gets bronze Arjun Erigaisi's remarkable World Blitz campaign ended with a semifinal loss to Nodirbek Abdusattorov, earning the Indian Grandmaster a historic double bronze. Magnus Carlsen set up a final showdown with Abdusattorov after overcoming Fabiano Caruana.

5th WT20I: India thump Sri Lanka to complete 5-0 clean sweep, ends 2025 with a bang With the final game of the series, Sri Lanka finally decided to wake up and put up their best performance in the series. But India proved to be too good for them as they went on to take the win by XX runs to complete the 5-0 series whitewash in Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday, December 30.

BBL: Taxi breaks down, Perth Scorchers players arrive at stadium by pushing Uber BBL: Hilarious scenes unfolded on Tuesday after some of the Perth Scorchers players got stuck on their way to the stadium. While travelling to the stadium, their Uber broke down, but they managed to revive the situation.

Watch: Glenn Phillips turns left hander, stuns fans with mega sixes New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips stunned the crowd by turning into a left-hander. Playing in the Super Smash, Phillips slam-banged his way to an unbeaten 90 runs off just 48 balls.

How Usman Khawaja should retire after 5th Ashes Test? Ex-Australia captain reveals plan Michael Clarke has tipped Usman Khawaja to retire from cricket after the SCG Test. Clarke is hoping that Khawaja can sign off on a high by scoring a hundred in front of his home crowd in Sydney.

Watch: Magnus loses cool again, board fumble leads to defeat at World Blitz C'ship Magnus Carlsen suffered a bizarre loss at the World Blitz Championship after fumbling his pieces with seconds left, leading to defeat against Haik Martirosyan in Doha.

IND vs SL: Smriti Mandhana rested for final T20I, India hand G Kamalini debutIndia have decided to rest Smriti Mandhana for the final T20I of the series against Sri Lanka. They have handed the young prodigy G Kamalini her debut for the match in Trivandrum.

Lasith Malinga joins Sri Lanka's coaching staff ahead of T20 World Cup 2026Lasith Malinga has been appointed Sri Lanka's fast-bowling consultant as part of their preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, bringing vast white-ball and coaching experience to the setup.

5th Women's T20I Highlights: India complete 5-0 sweep with 15-run winIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women Highlights: A commanding performance from the bowlers and a brilliant fifty from Harmanpreet Kaur was enough as India complete the 5-0 sweep over Sri Lanka to head into the new year with a big win.

Suryakumar Yadav used to message me a lot: Actor makes explosive claimActor Khushi Mukherjee has gone viral on social media after making a bombshell claim involving the India T20I captain. Mukherjee has claimed that Suryakumar Yadav used to message her frequently in the past. However, she has denied any romantic involvement with a cricketer.

T20 World Cup 2026: Oman name Jatinder Singh as captain, leave out veteran KaleemOman's most experienced player, Jatinder Singh, will captain the national team at the 2026 ICC Men's T20 World Cup after missing the previous edition. The squad features five changes from the Asia Cup, with veteran Aamir Kaleem omitted despite recent strong performances.

Australia, England are disregarding Ashes, disrespecting Test cricket: ChappellAshes: Legendary Greg Chappell has lashed out at the Australia and England teams after the Boxing Day Test match failed to last two days. In a scathing column, Chappell has written that both teams are disrespecting the legacy of Test cricket.

Ellyse Perry withdraws from WPL 2026 in big blow for Royal Challengers BengaluruEllyse Perry has withdrawn from the Women's Premier League 2026 due to personal reasons, with Sayali Satghare named as her replacement. USA pacer Tara Norris and Australian all-rounder Annabel Sutherland have also pulled out of the tournament.

Shaheen Shah Afridi returns home from BBL with knee injury ahead of T20 World CupPakistan's Shaheen Shah Afridi will return home from the Big Bash League after suffering a knee cartilage injury while fielding for Brisbane Heat.

ICC agrees with Gautam Gambhir's assessment, spares Kolkata pitch a poor ratingThe ICC rated the Eden Gardens pitch as 'satisfactory' despite criticism following India's Test defeat to South Africa. The decision contrasted with the Melbourne Cricket Ground receiving an 'unsatisfactory' rating, underlining differing pitch standards in international cricket.

Indian Olympic Association to host first athlete-led forum in Ahmedabad on Jan 10The Indian Olympic Association will convene its inaugural National Athletes' Forum on 10 January in Ahmedabad. The event aims to give athletes a direct role in shaping sports governance, with a focus on athlete rights, welfare, and policy reform.

Sensational Amelia Kerr warms up for WPL 2026 with maiden T20 centuryMumbai Indians' Amelia Kerr warmed up for WPL 2026 in emphatic fashion, smashing her maiden T20 century to lead Wellington to a 49-run win against Auckland and underline her all-round value ahead of the season.

Ashes: England players cleared as investigation into excessive drinking row endsAccording to a report from the Daily Mail, the England players have been given a clean chit as the investigation into the excessive drinking row has come to an end.

Pakistan hockey players threaten FIH Pro League boycott as pay dispute continuesSenior Pakistan hockey players have threatened to boycott the upcoming fixtures in Australia, citing significant discrepancies in daily allowances paid for the recent Argentina leg of the FIH Pro League. The dispute centers on a gap between the amount promised and the amount received, with federation and board officials citing conflicting policies and funding restrictions.

Barcelona president Joan Laporta accused of fraud, summoned to court: ReportFC Barcelona president Joan Laporta has been ordered to appear in court after being accused of fraud, according to a report by Spanish daily AS, placing renewed legal scrutiny on the club's senior leadership.

Smriti Mandhana sets sights on T20 World Cup, WPL after record-breaking 2025Smriti Mandhana is gearing up for a packed T20 roadmap toward 2026, regaining form against Sri Lanka while eyeing the WPL and T20 World Cup after a record-breaking year when she completed 10,000 runs in international cricket.

Ashes: Australian batting coach held accountable for Steve Smith's side's MCG failureFormer Australia opener Matthew Hayden has slammed the national team's batting coach following the heavy Ashes defeat at the MCG, questioning both coaching accountability and the technical preparedness of Australia's top-order batters as scrutiny intensifies ahead of upcoming Tests.

Shafali Verma, Renuka Singh gain big in ICC T20I rankings after Trivandrum heroicsShafali Verma and Renuka Singh have made significant jumps in the ICC Women's rankings after performing brilliantly in the Trivandrum leg of the T20I series against Sri Lanka. Shafali is the leading run-scorer of the series while Renuka took a four-wicket haul in the third T20I.

Brevis shows no game management: Proteas legend slams star's SA20 failuresHerschelle Gibbs questioned Dewald Brevis' game awareness after another SA20 failure. With the T20 World Cup 2026 approaching fast, the young batter's form is becoming a growing concern for South Africa.

Rohit, Kohli's Test retirements felt unnatural: Ex-batter's explosive claimRobin Uthappa questioned the timing of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's Test retirements. The former India batter feels the exits did not appear natural and believes the full truth may emerge later.

Abhishek Sharma was India's best in 2025: Ashwin urges ODI debut for batterRavichandran Ashwin believes Abhishek Sharma has been India's best performer of 2025. The former spinner also backed the explosive opener for an ODI debut after his game-changing impact in T20Is.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
